Gray\n\n# Title\ntitle = doc.add_paragraph()\nrun = title.add_run(&quot;Privacy Policy&quot;)\nrun.font.name = &#x27;Garamond&#x27;\nrun.font.size = Pt(24)\nrun.font.color.rgb = title_color\ntitle.alignment = WD_PARAGRAPH_ALIGNMENT.CENTER\n\n# Last updated date\nlast_updated = doc.add_paragraph()\nrun = last_updated.add_run(&quot;Last updated: [Insert Date]&quot;)\nrun.font.name = &#x27;Garamond&#x27;\nrun.font.size = Pt(12)\nrun.font.color.rgb = text_color\nlast_updated.alignment = WD_PARAGRAPH_ALIGNMENT.CENTER\n\n# Introduction\ndoc.add_paragraph()\nintro_heading = doc.add_paragraph()\nrun = intro_heading.add_run(&quot;Introduction&quot;)\nrun.font.name = &#x27;Garamond&#x27;\nrun.font.size = protecting your personal &quot;\n    &quot;information. However, no electronic transmission or storage method is completely secure, and we cannot guarantee its absolute security.&quot;),\n    (&quot;Your Rights and Choices&quot;, \n     &quot;Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information, such as:\\n\\n&quot;\n     &quot;- Accessing or updating your personal information\\n&quot;\n     &quot;- Requesting deletion of your information\\n&quot;\n     &quot;- Opting out of promotional communications by following unsubscribe instructions&quot;),\n    (&quot;Third-Party Links&quot;, \n     &quot;Our website may contain links to third-party websites. "message": { "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1730027534.935105, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["For creating narrative videos from stories and character layouts, here are some of the best free AI tools that can help you with various stages of production, from character creation to scene generation:\n\n### 1. **RunwayML** - Video Editing and Generative Effects\n   - **Features**: RunwayML offers a suite of tools, including video editing, image generation, and green screen removal. It has a text-to-video feature in its free tier and also offers AI-powered tools for creating effects or blending animated elements.\n   - **How to Use**: Use RunwayML\u2019s Gen-1 (text-to-video generation) to create clips that visually represent scenes or characters from your narrative.\n   - **Limitations**: Free version limits usage time and rendering quality.\n   - [RunwayML](https://runwayml.com/)\n\n### 2. **Pictory AI** - Story-Based Video Creation\n   - **Features**: Pictory AI generates videos based on scripts, using AI to choose images, video clips, and music that fit the storyline. The tool also supports automatic voiceover.\n   - **How to Use**: Input your story as a script, and Pictory will match visuals to your narrative, helping you build a character-driven video.\n   - **Limitations**: Free plan is limited in video length and features.\n   - [Pictory AI](https://pictory.ai/)\n\n### 3. **Lumen5** - Script-to-Video Tool\n   - **Features**: Lumen5 converts text into animated videos with dynamic text transitions and free stock video resources. It\u2019s excellent for adapting narrative excerpts into engaging visual formats.\n   - **How to Use**: Copy your story or dialogue into Lumen5\u2019s script editor, which will then create slides based on the text. Customize visuals to match characters and scenes.\n   - **Limitations**: Lumen5\u2019s free version includes watermarks and limited customization options.\n   - [Lumen5](https://lumen5.com/)\n\n### 4. **Storyboard That** - Storyboarding and Character Layout\n   - **Features**: This tool helps create storyboards with customizable character designs, expressions, and backgrounds to help you visually plan your narrative before final production.\n   - **How to Use**: Create and arrange scenes to develop story flow, capturing your character&#x27;s physical appearance, settings, and important actions.\n   - **Limitations**: Free version limits the number of storyboards and scene customization options.\n   - [Storyboard That](https://www.storyboardthat.com/)\n\n### 5. **Synthesia** - AI Video Narration with Avatars\n   - **Features**: Synthesia offers AI avatars to narrate stories or character dialogues. Choose an avatar and type the dialogue to turn text into spoken video, adding life to your narrative videos.\n   - **How to Use**: Write your character\u2019s dialogue and select an avatar to narrate it, bringing your characters to life through synthetic voices.\n   - **Limitations**: Free version limits access to certain avatars and voices.\n   - [Synthesia](https://www.synthesia.io/)\n\n### 6. **CapCut** - Video Editing and AI Effects (Mobile/Desktop)\n   - **Features**: CapCut is a video editing app that offers AI-driven filters, transitions, and effects to enhance scenes. It has templates for easy visual storytelling and supports adding captions.\n   - **How to Use**: Use CapCut to edit generated clips or add finishing touches to your narrative video, such as scene transitions and effects.\n   - **Limitations**: Requires downloading the app, and some features are limited in the free version.\n   - [CapCut](https://www.capcut.com/)\n\n### Tips for Combining These Tools\n- Start with **Storyboard That** to lay out scenes and character concepts.\n- Use **Pictory AI** or **Lumen5** to turn text-based story content into animated scenes.\n- Integrate **Synthesia** for character dialogues or narrations.\n- Finally, polish the video with **CapCut** or **RunwayML** for high-quality effects and finishing touches.\n\nThis multi-tool approach can give your narrative videos a professional finish without any cost!"]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

Fitness Products as a ClickBank Affiliate\n\nFitness products have a vast upsell potential (especially comprehensive programs like Yogaburn).\u00a0\n\nAll you have to do is ensure your audience stays engaged even after the first purchase. Create a retention (or perhaps even referral) program, set up email sequences, and produce helpful content.\n\nSince you\u2019ll want to know about every single conversion and upsell, it\u2019s a ClickBank affiliate best practice to enable conversion tracking.\u00a0Data slips through the cracks with typical (ad) tracking. We recommend \u301015\u2020using S2S (server-side) conversion tracking\u3011 so you get accurate payouts and know which channels work best for your ClickBank offers.\n\n[Image 7: reporting for ad agencies][Image 8: reporting for ad agencies]\n\nKnow exactly which channel is over- and under-performing. Then, double down on what works!\n\n## 3. Find a Professional ClickBank Offer like Midas Manifestation (and Make Your Work 50x Easier)\n\nSelf-help is all the rage these days, so it\u2019s no surprise that \u301016\u2020Midas Manifestation\u2020midasmanifestation.com\u3011 is one of the highest-converting ClickBank offers.\n\nIf it\u2019s a good fit for your audience, it\u2019s worth checking out for the $3 EPC, up to 90% commission, and credit for upsells and follow-up sales.\u00a0\n\nPlus, you can promote the Midas Manifestation product as an affiliate even on Facebook Ads.\u00a0\n\n[Image 9][Image 10]\n\n### ClickBank Affiliate Best Practice: Look for Affiliate Offer Professionalism\n\nOnly some ClickBank products have well-structured affiliate programs. Others may waste your time because you\u2019ll have to spend your resources to promote them.\n\nIn contrast, products like Midas Manifestation show clear signs of a professional affiliate offer:\n\n  * You get an email swipe file with well-performing email templates.\n  * They offer a Facebook Ad kit and plenty of banners.\n  * Need help? They have a support team that you can contact.\n\nSince products like Midas Manifestation support different channels, ensure your \u301017\u2020multi-platform ad tracking\u3011 is solid.\n\n[Image 11][Image 12]\n\nDon\u2019t waste your budget on ineffective channels and campaigns; identify the best approach with an affiliate-friendly marketing attribution tool like \u301018\u2020RedTrack\u3011.\n\n## 4. Are There Profitable Affiliate ClickBank Offers for Hobby Products? You Bet!\n\nAnd \u301019\u2020Ted\u2019s Woodworking\u2020www.tedswoodworking.com\u3011 is one of them! If your audience loves DIY-ing or woodworking, they\u2019ll love the library of constantly updated woodworking plans.\n\n(As an affiliate, you\u2019ll love the upsell potential. ;))\n\nTed\u2019s Woodworking program typically sees 10% conversions on cold and 23% on warm traffic, with upsell opportunities and membership offers you can use to generate more revenue.\n\n[Image 13][Image 14]\n\n### Best Practices for Promoting ClickBank Affiliate Products in the Hobby Niche\n\nThe riches are definitely in the niches and when promoting a hobby product, choose yours wisely.\u00a0\n\nDon\u2019t be afraid to hop on Reddit or other forums to understand how your audience thinks and behaves, so you can profitably position your hobby ClickBank product.\n\nKeep your audience engaged. The DIY and woodworking niches are constantly growing, but don\u2019t let existing customers slip away.\u00a0\n\nMeasure your success. For example, evaluate how well your existing affiliate customers respond to specific channels. Do they prefer organic content? Google Ads retargeting? TikTok?\n\nTest, mix &amp; match, and don\u2019t forget to \u301020\u2020track\u3011!\n\n## 5. Just make sure you\u2026\n\n### Best Practices for ClickBank Affiliate Marketing\n\nWhen it comes to info products, you need great content. If your audience responds well to the ClickBank product, don\u2019t be afraid to go all-in:\n\n  * Explore how competitors promote similar products on YouTube, TikTok, and via search traffic\n  * Create content with honest reviews\n  * Respond to frequent questions\u00a0\n  * Address common objections\n\nThen, wrap it all up into a fantastic experience and watch your conversions skyrocket!\n\n## Bonus Tip for Maximizing Your ClickBank Revenue\n\nIf you\u2019re serious about ClickBank affiliate marketing, don\u2019t leave money on the table with outdated conversion tracking.\u00a0Instead, \u30102\u2020sign up for RedTrack\u3011 and \u301012\u2020integrate it with ClickBank\u2020docs.redtrack.io\u3011 in a few easy steps!\n\nEnabling powerful tracking only takes a few minutes.\u00a0Then, it delivers extra revenue and insights, so you get more value from every single ClickBank product in your affiliate roster.\n\n[Image 17][Image 18]\n\n\u30107\u2020 \u3011 \n\n\u30107\u2020 Posted by Polina Fetissova \u3011 \n\nHey! We code those designs into\n\nchallenger web pages. Then, we A/B test our pages against the\n\noriginal to measure impact.\n\nThe position is remote.\u00a0 We have a track record of promoting high\n\nperformers into leadership positions irrespective of geography.\u00a0 50%\n\nof our leadership team joined the company as entry level remote\n\nemployees.\n\n\u00a0\u00a0\n\nProject Manager is a client-facing role that has three main\n\nresponsibilities:\n\nCoordination. Running big A/B tests requires teams of 5-10 people\n\n(researchers, strategists, designers, copywriters, developers, QA,\n\nanalysts, clients, etc). You coordinate the teams and keep pushing the\n\nproject forward.\n\nStrategy &amp; Planning. You build the roadmap for the next 10 - 20\n\ntests. You sell the vision to clients and communicate progress in\n\nweekly client meetings.\n\nEnergy. As the point of contact for the client and internal teams, you\n\nget everyone excited about testing and bring the energy!\n\n\u00a0\n\nWe don\u2019t expect AB Testing experience - we can train you. We are\n\nlooking for:\n\n1) Extreme diligence and organization. You make the trains run on\n\ntime!\n\n2) Experience in project management, preferably in a software or\n\nagency setting.\n\n3) Excellent communication skills. OF YOUR OLD FURNITURE\n\nCentrufficio spa, in the case of projects involving the purchase of new furniture, offers the customer a take-back service for existing furniture.\n\nWhen dealing with a move or a change in the layout of one\u2019s office space with the renewal of furniture, one of the most important operations to be carried out concerns the management and disposal of used furniture, since very often these are materials that must be carefully disassembled and separated into their wooden, metal and plastic components.\n\nHow the \u2018buy with take-back\u2019 formula works:\n\n1. In the case of the purchase of new furniture, Centrufficio carries out an inspection at the customer\u2019s premises to view the existing furniture and assess the feasibility of collection.\n\n2. Following this inspection, an agreement is reached with the client on the date and method of collecting the furniture, which very often coincides with the delivery of the new furniture.\n\n3. The disposal of the furniture includes collection (also on the floor), dismantling, disassembly of components and disposal of the various materials in accordance with the law.\n\n4. We can also carry out removals of pre-existing furniture, providing for its disassembly, floor collection, packing, return and reassembly.\n\n\u301038\u2020Contact us\u3011 to evaluate the purchase of new furniture with disposal service.\n\n\u00a9 Copyright 2024 Centrufficio S.p.A. - Sede societaria Viale Andrea Doria 17 - 20124 Milano (MI) Italia - P.IVA 00902270966 - CF 08312370151 - REA: 1215041 di Milano del 20/05/86 Iscrizione alla CCIA di Milano: 08312370151 (sezione ordinaria) - Capitale sociale e riserve: \u20ac 38.250.000 - Registro AEE n. \u301031\u2020Catalogs\u3011\n    * \u301039\u2020Corporate Certifications\u3011\n    * \u301040\u2020Product Certifications\u3011\n    * \u301041\u2020Product sheets\u3011\n\n  *   \n\n# WE DISPOSE OF YOUR OLD FURNITURE\n\nCentrufficio spa, in the case of projects involving the purchase of new furniture, offers the customer a take-back service for existing furniture.\n\nWhen dealing with a move or a change in the layout of one\u2019s office space with the renewal of furniture, one of the most important operations to be carried out concerns the management and disposal of used furniture, since very often these are materials that must be carefully disassembled and separated into their wooden, metal and plastic components.\n\nHow the \u2018buy with take-back\u2019 formula works:\n\n1. In the case of the purchase of new furniture, Centrufficio carries out an inspection at the customer\u2019s premises to view the existing furniture and assess the feasibility of collection.\n\n2. Following this inspection, an agreement is reached with the client on the date and method of collecting the furniture, which very often coincides with the delivery of the new furniture.\n\n3. The disposal of the furniture includes collection (also on the floor), dismantling, disassembly of components and disposal of the various materials in accordance with the law.\n\n4. We can also carry out removals of pre-existing furniture, providing for its disassembly, floor collection, packing, return and reassembly.\n\n\u301038\u2020Contact us\u3011 to evaluate the purchase of new furniture with disposal service.\n\n\u00a9 Copyright 2024 Centrufficio S.p.A. - Sede societaria Viale Andrea Doria 17 - 20124 Milano (MI) Italia - P.IVA 00902270966 - CF 08312370151 - REA: 1215041 di Milano del 20/05/86 Iscrizione alla CCIA di Milano: 08312370151 (sezione ordinaria) - Capitale sociale e riserve: \u20ac 38.250.000 - Registro AEE n. We employ a network of professionals in the sector, with whom we boast twenty years of experience. Our main services are: collection, transport and disposal of rubble and construction waste In addition to collection and disposal of: wood, plasterboard, plaster, sheathing, tar, asphalt, rubber, paper and cardboard, plastic, metals, prunings. Clearance of cellars, local attics and warehouses. Collection and transport of furniture, machinery, sets. We employ a network of professionals in the sector, with whom we boast twenty years of experience. Our main services are: collection, transport and disposal of rubble and construction waste In addition to collection and disposal of: wood, plasterboard, plaster, sheathing, tar, asphalt, rubber, paper and cardboard, plastic, metals, prunings. Clearance of cellars, local attics and warehouses. Collection and transport of furniture, machinery, sets. Couches can be broken down for recycling at your local recycling facility. Couches often contain metal springs, wood, cotton fabric and foam core that is easily recycled, but you\u2019ll have to deal with hauling it there, wait times and fees.\n\nIf you don\u2019t have the time or vehicle to deal with it yourself, the most convenient way to recycle a couch is to \u301011\u2020book LoadUp online\u3011 to haul it away and try to find the greenest disposal method for your old couch and any other unwanted junk you need to get rid of.\n\nHow do you get rid of old couches?\n\nThe easiest way to get rid of old couches is to have them removed and hauled away for proper disposal by \u301012\u2020scheduling a pickup\u3011 with a junk removal company like LoadUp that specialize in haul away services for couches and other types of furniture.\n\nHow much does sofa disposal cost?\n\nThe best way to find cheap couch removal without skimping on the quality of service is to go with a licensed and insured junk removal company like LoadUp. No hidden fees or surprise charges, ever.\n\nCan I leave my old couch at the curb?\n\nWhen you schedule convenient curbside couch pickup services with us, we\u2019ll come to get it from right in front of your home or office. If you haven\u2019t scheduled a furniture removal service with us, you shouldn\u2019t leave your couch at the curb. Couches are bulky items that require a special bulk pickup with your local waste management company, who will take it to a landfill.\n\nCan I leave my couch by the dumpster?\n\nAlthough you can technically throw a couch in a dumpster, you shouldn\u2019t. Throwing items in a dumpster \u301069\u2020without permission\u3011 can get you in trouble with the dumpster owner, and even the law. Check your state\u2019s illegal dumping laws for more information about fines and other penalties.\n\nAn easier way to get rid of an unwanted couch is to have it removed by a professional junk removal service. Couches often contain metal springs, wood, cotton fabric and foam core that is easily recycled, but you\u2019ll have to deal with hauling it there, wait times and fees.\n\nIf you don\u2019t have the time or vehicle to deal with it yourself, the most convenient way to recycle a couch is to \u301011\u2020book LoadUp online\u3011 to haul it away and try to find the greenest disposal method for your old couch and any other unwanted junk you need to get rid of.\n\nHow do you get rid of old couches?\n\nThe easiest way to get rid of old couches is to have them removed and hauled away for proper disposal by \u301012\u2020scheduling a pickup\u3011 with a junk removal company like LoadUp that specialize in haul away services for couches and other types of furniture.\n\nHow much does sofa disposal cost?\n\nThe best way to find cheap couch removal without skimping on the quality of service is to go with a licensed and insured junk removal company like LoadUp. Our average price for \u301011\u2020sofa disposal starts at $80\u3011. We don\u2019t require on-site estimates, so the amount you\u2019re quoted is the amount you\u2019ll pay. No hidden fees or surprise charges, ever.\n\nCan I leave my old couch at the curb?\n\nWhen you schedule convenient curbside couch pickup services with us, we\u2019ll come to get it from right in front of your home or office. If you haven\u2019t scheduled a furniture removal service with us, you shouldn\u2019t leave your couch at the curb. Couches are bulky items that require a special bulk pickup with your local waste management company, who will take it to a landfill.\n\nCan I leave my couch by the dumpster?\n\nAlthough you can technically throw a couch in a dumpster, you shouldn\u2019t. Throwing items in a dumpster \u301069\u2020without permission\u3011 can get you in trouble with the dumpster owner, and even the law. Check your state\u2019s illegal dumping laws for more information about fines and other penalties.\n\nAn easier way to get rid of an unwanted couch is to have it removed by a professional junk removal service. At LoadUp, we\u2019ll haul away your old couch, sectional sofa, recliner or any other furniture you need removed from anywhere in your home. Don\u2019t risk getting in trouble for illegal dumping when you can just LoadUp, dude!\n\n## Professional couch hauling with upfront pricing at your fingertips.\n\nIf you have a \u301060\u2020used sectional\u3011 or sleeper sofa that you don\u2019t need, you can get the old, unwanted couch hauled away the next-day! Whether your couch is saggy and gross or ready for a new love, LoadUp will help haul away your old couch at your convenience!\n\n[Image 16: In-Home Couch Removal] \n\n### Luxury in-home pickup.\n\nWe provide convenient in-home couch pickup services where we do all of the heavy lifting and hauling for you! OF YOUR OLD FURNITURE\n\nCentrufficio spa, in the case of projects involving the purchase of new furniture, offers the customer a take-back service for existing furniture.\n\nWhen dealing with a move or a change in the layout of one\u2019s office space with the renewal of furniture, one of the most important operations to be carried out concerns the management and disposal of used furniture, since very often these are materials that must be carefully disassembled and separated into their wooden, metal and plastic components.\n\nHow the \u2018buy with take-back\u2019 formula works:\n\n1. In the case of the purchase of new furniture, Centrufficio carries out an inspection at the customer\u2019s premises to view the existing furniture and assess the feasibility of collection.\n\n2. Following this inspection, an agreement is reached with the client on the date and method of collecting the furniture, which very often coincides with the delivery of the new furniture.\n\n3. The disposal of the furniture includes collection (also on the floor), dismantling, disassembly of components and disposal of the various materials in accordance with the law.\n\n4. We can also carry out removals of pre-existing furniture, providing for its disassembly, floor collection, packing, return and reassembly.\n\n\u301038\u2020Contact us\u3011 to evaluate the purchase of new furniture with disposal service.\n\n\u00a9 Copyright 2024 Centrufficio S.p.A. - Sede societaria Viale Andrea Doria 17 - 20124 Milano (MI) Italia - P.IVA 00902270966 - CF 08312370151 - REA: 1215041 di Milano del 20/05/86 Iscrizione alla CCIA di Milano: 08312370151 (sezione ordinaria) - Capitale sociale e riserve: \u20ac 38.250.000 - Registro AEE n. Couches can be broken down for recycling at your local recycling facility. Couches often contain metal springs, wood, cotton fabric and foam core that is easily recycled, but you\u2019ll have to deal with hauling it there, wait times and fees.\n\nIf you don\u2019t have the time or vehicle to deal with it yourself, the most convenient way to recycle a couch is to \u301011\u2020book LoadUp online\u3011 to haul it away and try to find the greenest disposal method for your old couch and any other unwanted junk you need to get rid of.\n\nHow do you get rid of old couches?\n\nThe easiest way to get rid of old couches is to have them removed and hauled away for proper disposal by \u301012\u2020scheduling a pickup\u3011 with a junk removal company like LoadUp that specialize in haul away services for couches and other types of furniture.\n\nHow much does sofa disposal cost?\n\nThe best way to find cheap couch removal without skimping on the quality of service is to go with a licensed and insured junk removal company like LoadUp. Our average price for \u301011\u2020sofa disposal starts at $80\u3011. We don\u2019t require on-site estimates, so the amount you\u2019re quoted is the amount you\u2019ll pay. No hidden fees or surprise charges, ever.\n\nCan I leave my old couch at the curb?\n\nWhen you schedule convenient curbside couch pickup services with us, we\u2019ll come to get it from right in front of your home or office. If you haven\u2019t scheduled a furniture removal service with us, you shouldn\u2019t leave your couch at the curb. Couches are bulky items that require a special bulk pickup with your local waste management company, who will take it to a landfill.\n\nCan I leave my couch by the dumpster?\n\nAlthough you can technically throw a couch in a dumpster, you shouldn\u2019t. Throwing items in a dumpster \u301069\u2020without permission\u3011 can get you in trouble with the dumpster owner, and even the law. Check your state\u2019s illegal dumping laws for more information about fines and other penalties.\n\nAn easier way to get rid of an unwanted couch is to have it removed by a professional junk removal service. At LoadUp, we\u2019ll haul away your old couch, sectional sofa, recliner or any other furniture you need removed from anywhere in your home. OF YOUR OLD FURNITURE\n\nCentrufficio spa, in the case of projects involving the purchase of new furniture, offers the customer a take-back service for existing furniture.\n\nWhen dealing with a move or a change in the layout of one\u2019s office space with the renewal of furniture, one of the most important operations to be carried out concerns the management and disposal of used furniture, since very often these are materials that must be carefully disassembled and separated into their wooden, metal and plastic components.\n\nHow the \u2018buy with take-back\u2019 formula works:\n\n1. In the case of the purchase of new furniture, Centrufficio carries out an inspection at the customer\u2019s premises to view the existing furniture and assess the feasibility of collection.\n\n2. Following this inspection, an agreement is reached with the client on the date and method of collecting the furniture, which very often coincides with the delivery of the new furniture.\n\n3. The disposal of the furniture includes collection (also on the floor), dismantling, disassembly of components and disposal of the various materials in accordance with the law.\n\n4. We can also carry out removals of pre-existing furniture, providing for its disassembly, floor collection, packing, return and reassembly.\n\n\u301038\u2020Contact us\u3011 to evaluate the purchase of new furniture with disposal service.\n\n\u00a9 Copyright 2024 Centrufficio S.p.A. - Sede societaria Viale Andrea Doria 17 - 20124 Milano (MI) Italia - P.IVA 00902270966 - CF 08312370151 - REA: 1215041 di Milano del 20/05/86 Iscrizione alla CCIA di Milano: 08312370151 (sezione ordinaria) - Capitale sociale e riserve: \u20ac 38.250.000 - Registro AEE n. Calcinacci Rome\n\n[Image 1: Calcinacci Rome]\n\n# Calcinacci Rome   \nVia Latina, Roma , Roma, Italy\n\nMemberships : NA \n\nIndustry : \u301051\u2020Waste Collection &amp; Disposal\u3011\n\n[Image 2: Badge]\n\nBasic Member   \nSince Sep, 2023\n\n0 Reviews Write a Review\n\n  * Company Intro \n  * Services \n  * Key Contacts\n\n&quot;We encourage all members to participate in trading activities ONLY with verified members&quot; \u301052\u2020You can get verified here\u3011 \n\nAbout Company \n\nCalcinacci Roma deals with the disposal, collection and transport of rubble and construction waste. We employ a network of professionals in the sector, with whom we boast twenty years of experience. Our main services are: collection, transport and disposal of rubble and construction waste In addition to collection and disposal of: wood, plasterboard, plaster, sheathing, tar, asphalt, rubber, paper and cardboard, plastic, metals, prunings. Clearance of cellars, local attics and warehouses. Collection and transport of furniture, machinery, sets. If you haven\u2019t scheduled a furniture removal service with us, you shouldn\u2019t leave your couch at the curb. Couches are bulky items that require a special bulk pickup with your local waste management company, who will take it to a landfill.\n\nCan I leave my couch by the dumpster?\n\nAlthough you can technically throw a couch in a dumpster, you shouldn\u2019t. Throwing items in a dumpster \u301069\u2020without permission\u3011 can get you in trouble with the dumpster owner, and even the law. Check your state\u2019s illegal dumping laws for more information about fines and other penalties.\n\nAn easier way to get rid of an unwanted couch is to have it removed by a professional junk removal service. dell\u2019Accademia Nazionale di Santa Cecilia]\n\n  1. \u301077\u2020 Home \u3011 \n  2. \u301015\u2020 News \u3011 \n  3. \u301078\u2020 Free collection of bulky waste in Rome \u3011 \n\n\u301015\u2020 News \u3011  \u301079\u2020 City \u3011 \n\n#  Free collection of bulky waste in Rome \n\nBy: \u301077\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \n\nDate:\n\n05 Nov, 2019\n\n#### Large domestic items can be dropped to collection centres on 10 November.\n\nThe capital&#x27;s refuse agency AMA Roma will accept bulky household waste, such as old furniture, mattresses, televisions and washing machines, from the city&#x27;s even-numbered boroughs, or municipi, on Sunday 10 November.\n\nThe free service, known as &quot;Il tuo quartiere non \u00e8 una discarica&quot; (Your neighbourhood is not a dump) will be available from 08.00 until 13.00.\n\nAMA has set up 26 collection points around the city - seven permanent collection centres and 19 set up especially for the initiative.\n\nFor full details, including your nearest collection point, see \u301080\u2020AMA website\u2020www.amaroma.it\u3011.\n\nPhoto by Wanted in Rome. Via Galvani, Testaccio, 5 November 2019.\n\nSHARE\n\n\u301081\u2020 Facebook \u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 \u301082\u2020 Twitter \u2020twitter.com\u3011  \u301083\u2020 \u2020pinterest.com\u3011 \u301084\u2020 \u2020send\u3011 \n\n  * Categories / Tags\n  * \u301079\u2020City\u3011\n\nPrevious article \u301085\u2020Petrol station strike in Italy\u3011 \n\nNext article \u301086\u2020Rome&#x27;s St Patrick&#x27;s Library to close after 60 years\u3011 \n\n\u301077\u2020 \u3011 \n\n\u301077\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \u301077\u2020https://www.wantedinrome.com\u3011 \n\nWanted in Rome is a monthly magazine in English for expatriates in Rome established in 1985. The magazine covers Rome news stories that may be of interest to English and Italian speaking residents, and tourists as well. The publication also offers classifieds, photos, information on events, museums, churches, galleries, exhibits, fashion, food, and local travel.\n\n\u301087\u2020 \u301021\u2020Jobs vacant\u3011\n    * \u301022\u2020Jobs wanted\u3011\n    * \u301018\u2020Insert your Classified\u3011\n  * \u301023\u2020Housing\u3011\n    * \u301024\u2020Accommodation vacant in town\u3011\n    * \u301025\u2020Accommodation vacant out of town\u3011\n    * \u301030\u2020Accommodation wanted\u3011\n    * \u301029\u2020Holiday Accommodation\u3011\n    * \u301026\u2020Property for sale in town\u3011\n    * \u301027\u2020Property for sale out of town\u3011\n    * \u301028\u2020Rooms and flat shares\u3011\n\n[Image 1: Ambrit 1920 x 116]\n\n[Image 2: Ambrit 1920 x 116]\n\n[Image 3: Ambrit 1920 x 116]\n\n[Image 4: AuR Summer 24 700 x 180]\n\n  1. \u301079\u2020 Home \u3011 \n  2. \u301015\u2020 News \u3011 \n  3. \u301080\u2020 Free collection for bulky waste \u3011 \n\n\u301015\u2020 News \u3011  \u301081\u2020 Environment \u3011 \n\n#  Free collection for bulky waste \n\nBy: \u301079\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \n\nDate:\n\n27 Mar, 2013\n\nFrom 2 April the capital&#x27;s refuse company AMA Roma will provide a free home collection service for bulky household rubbish, such as sofas, beds, televisions sets and washing machines, which will be taken away for recycling and correct disposal.\n\nThere is no cost for the service which is only for domestic use and is aimed at tackling the problem of illegal dumping. The new home collection service will replace the 186 mobile collection points around the city, which will be phased out by 30 April.\n\nThe service permits householders to throw out up to two cubic metres of volume which is the equivalent of a three-seater couch; a table plus large-screen television; or a washing machine and dishwasher. The service can be used up to a maximum of 12 times a year and no more than twice a month.\n\nIn addition to the bulky household waste, AMA will also collect electronic appliances such as washing machines, refrigerators, freezers, dishwashers, computers, monitors, printers, televisions, music systems, fans and hair dryers.\n\nHowever the service does not include toxic or hazardous waste such as used batteries, expired medicines, neon lighting tubes, solvents or material containing asbestos. Neither does it include objects that are burnt, wet or mouldy.\n\nIn cases where the amount of rubbish to be thrown out adds up to more than two cubic metres, or is non-domestic waste, AMA Roma continues its collection system of before, for a fee.\n\nThe new service works by making an appointment by calling 060606 Mon-Fri from 09.00-18.00 and Sat 09.00-16.00, alternatively by filling out the online form on the \u301082\u2020AMA website\u2020www.amaroma.it\u3011. When booking, just insert your individual user code (found on the top right of your AMA bills).\n\nOnce an appointment is made, the objects being thrown out must be taken to the street level for collection. The AMA workers will have an identity badge and will provide you with a receipt outlining the type of material collected.\n\nSHARE\n\n\u301083\u2020 Facebook \u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 \u301084\u2020 Twitter \u2020twitter.com\u3011  \u301085\u2020 \u2020pinterest.com\u3011 \u301086\u2020 \u2020send\u3011 \n\n  * Categories / Tags\n  * \u301081\u2020Environment\u3011\n\nPrevious article \u301087\u2020The Italian mar\u00f2 and India\u3011 \n\nNext article \u301087\u2020The Italian mar\u00f2 and India\u3011 \n\n\u301079\u2020 \u3011 \n\n\u301079\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \u301079\u2020https://www.wantedinrome.com\u3011 \n\nWanted in Rome is a monthly magazine in English for expatriates in Rome established in 1985. The magazine covers Rome news stories that may be of interest to English and Italian speaking residents, and tourists as well. The publication also offers classifieds, photos, information on events, museums, churches, galleries, exhibits, fashion, food, and local travel.\n\n\u301088\u2020 \u301015\u2020 News \u3011 \n  3. \u301080\u2020 Free collection for bulky waste \u3011 \n\n\u301015\u2020 News \u3011  \u301081\u2020 Environment \u3011 \n\n#  Free collection for bulky waste \n\nBy: \u301079\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \n\nDate:\n\n27 Mar, 2013\n\nFrom 2 April the capital&#x27;s refuse company AMA Roma will provide a free home collection service for bulky household rubbish, such as sofas, beds, televisions sets and washing machines, which will be taken away for recycling and correct disposal.\n\nThere is no cost for the service which is only for domestic use and is aimed at tackling the problem of illegal dumping. The new home collection service will replace the 186 mobile collection points around the city, which will be phased out by 30 April.\n\nThe service permits householders to throw out up to two cubic metres of volume which is the equivalent of a three-seater couch; a table plus large-screen television; or a washing machine and dishwasher. The service can be used up to a maximum of 12 times a year and no more than twice a month.\n\nIn addition to the bulky household waste, AMA will also collect electronic appliances such as washing machines, refrigerators, freezers, dishwashers, computers, monitors, printers, televisions, music systems, fans and hair dryers.\n\nHowever the service does not include toxic or hazardous waste such as used batteries, expired medicines, neon lighting tubes, solvents or material containing asbestos. Neither does it include objects that are burnt, wet or mouldy.\n\nIn cases where the amount of rubbish to be thrown out adds up to more than two cubic metres, or is non-domestic waste, AMA Roma continues its collection system of before, for a fee.\n\nThe new service works by making an appointment by calling 060606 Mon-Fri from 09.00-18.00 and Sat 09.00-16.00, alternatively by filling out the online form on the \u301082\u2020AMA website\u2020www.amaroma.it\u3011. When booking, just insert your individual user code (found on the top right of your AMA bills).\n\nOnce an appointment is made, the objects being thrown out must be taken to the street level for collection. The AMA workers will have an identity badge and will provide you with a receipt outlining the type of material collected.\n\nSHARE\n\n\u301083\u2020 Facebook \u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 \u301084\u2020 Twitter \u2020twitter.com\u3011  \u301085\u2020 \u2020pinterest.com\u3011 \u301086\u2020 \u2020send\u3011 \n\n  * Categories / Tags\n  * \u301081\u2020Environment\u3011\n\nPrevious article \u301087\u2020The Italian mar\u00f2 and India\u3011 \n\nNext article \u301087\u2020The Italian mar\u00f2 and India\u3011 \n\n\u301079\u2020 \u3011 \n\n\u301079\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \u301079\u2020https://www.wantedinrome.com\u3011 \n\nWanted in Rome is a monthly magazine in English for expatriates in Rome established in 1985. waste collection service in Rome \u3011 \n\n\u301015\u2020 News \u3011  \u301079\u2020 Environment \u3011 \n\n#  Return of bulky waste collection service in Rome \n\nBy: \u301077\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \n\nDate:\n\n01 Dec, 2016\n\nAMA Roma reinstates collection of large domestic items.\n\nThe capital&#x27;s refuse agency AMA Roma has reinstated its collection of bulky household waste, which had been suspended since 18 June due to a non-renewal of the contract.\n\nThe service, which is active from 1 December, includes the collection of items such as old sofas, beds, televisions sets and washing machines.\n\nThe service is free for those living on street level, as well as from courtyards, front doors or accessible garages, with a maximum of two cubic metres of volume. This is the equivalent of a three-seater couch; a table plus large-screen television; or a washing machine and dishwasher.\n\nFor those without street access there is a collection fee: \u20ac18.34 for up to one cubic metre of waste, or \u20ac29.34 for up to two cubic metres. The service \u2013 for street level and upper level \u2013 can be used up to a maximum of 12 times a year and no more than twice a month.\n\nTo book an appointment tel. 060606 Mon-Fri from 09.00-18.00 and Sat 09.00-16.00, alternatively compile the online form on the \u301080\u2020AMA website\u2020www.amaroma.it\u3011. When booking, insert your individual user code (found on the top right of your AMA bills).\n\nThe reactivation of the service follows the recent \u301081\u2020&quot;Frigogate&quot; \u3011comments by Rome mayor Virginia Raggi who voiced suspicions over an allegedly large amount of refrigerators abandoned on streets around the capital.\n\nSHARE\n\n\u301082\u2020 Facebook \u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 \u301083\u2020 Twitter \u2020twitter.com\u3011  \u301084\u2020 \u2020pinterest.com\u3011 \u301085\u2020 \u2020send\u3011 \n\n  * Categories / Tags\n  * \u301079\u2020Environment\u3011\n\nPrevious article \u301086\u2020World AIDS Day in Rome\u3011 \n\nNext article \u301087\u2020Fire destroys Rome&#x27;s Pineta Sacchetti auditorium\u3011 \n\n\u301077\u2020 \u3011 \n\n\u301077\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \u301077\u2020https://www.wantedinrome.com\u3011 \n\nWanted in Rome is a monthly magazine in English for expatriates in Rome established in 1985. The magazine covers Rome news stories that may be of interest to English and Italian speaking residents, and tourists as well. The publication also offers classifieds, photos, information on events, museums, churches, galleries, exhibits, fashion, food, and local travel.\n\n\u301088\u2020 Rome\u3011 \n\nDate:\n\n01 Dec, 2016\n\nAMA Roma reinstates collection of large domestic items.\n\nThe capital&#x27;s refuse agency AMA Roma has reinstated its collection of bulky household waste, which had been suspended since 18 June due to a non-renewal of the contract.\n\nThe service, which is active from 1 December, includes the collection of items such as old sofas, beds, televisions sets and washing machines.\n\nThe service is free for those living on street level, as well as from courtyards, front doors or accessible garages, with a maximum of two cubic metres of volume. This is the equivalent of a three-seater couch; a table plus large-screen television; or a washing machine and dishwasher.\n\nFor those without street access there is a collection fee: \u20ac18.34 for up to one cubic metre of waste, or \u20ac29.34 for up to two cubic metres. The service \u2013 for street level and upper level \u2013 can be used up to a maximum of 12 times a year and no more than twice a month.\n\nTo book an appointment tel. 060606 Mon-Fri from 09.00-18.00 and Sat 09.00-16.00, alternatively compile the online form on the \u301080\u2020AMA website\u2020www.amaroma.it\u3011. "text", "parts": ["Yes, AMA Roma does offer a free bulky waste collection service for residents, which includes items like couches, beds, and other large household items. This service is called &quot;Il tuo quartiere non \u00e8 una discarica&quot; (&quot;Your neighborhood is not a dump&quot;) and is available by appointment. You can schedule a pickup by calling 060606 from Monday to Friday, 09:00-18:00, or on Saturday from 09:00-16:00. Alternatively, you can fill out an online form on the [AMA website](https://www.amaroma.it) to book the collection\u301017\u2020source\u3011\u301018\u2020source\u3011.\n\nThe service allows up to two cubic meters of bulky waste, such as a three-seater couch, and is available up to 12 times per year per household, free of charge for those living at street level or from accessible garages. If you are on an upper level without easy street access, there may be a small fee involved.\n\nThis should be a good option for disposing of your couch in La Rustica. Let me know if you need more details or assistance with the booking process!"]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

refugee centre holds fundraiser dinner with Latin American food\u3011 \n\n08 Oct, 2024\n\n  * \u301017\u2020Classifieds\u3011\n    * \u301019\u2020How to insert your Classifieds\u3011\n    * \u301018\u2020Insert your Classified\u3011\n    * \u301033\u2020About our Yellow Pages\u3011\n    * \u301032\u2020Insert your Yellow Page\u3011\n  * \u301078\u2020More cities\u3011\n    * \u301038\u2020Turin\u2020www.wantedinmilan.com\u3011\n  * \u301011\u2020Magazine\u3011\n    * \u301011\u2020Magazine issues\u3011\n    * \u301046\u2020Images of the day\u3011\n    * \u301023\u2020Housing\u3011\n    * \u301024\u2020Accommodation vacant in town\u3011\n    * \u301025\u2020Accommodation vacant out of town\u3011\n    * \u301030\u2020Accommodation wanted\u3011\n    * \u301029\u2020Holiday Accommodation\u3011\n    * \u301026\u2020Property for sale in town\u3011\n    * \u301027\u2020Property for sale out of town\u3011\n    * \u301028\u2020Rooms and flat shares\u3011\n\n[Image 1: Ambrit 1920 x 116]\n\n[Image 2: Ambrit 1920 x 116]\n\n[Image 3: Ambrit 1920 x 116]\n\n[Image 4: AuR Summer 24 700 x 180]\n\n  1. \u301079\u2020 Home \u3011 \n  2. \u301015\u2020 News \u3011 \n  3. \u301080\u2020 Free collection for bulky waste \u3011 \n\n\u301015\u2020 News \u3011  \u301081\u2020 Environment \u3011 \n\n#  Free collection for bulky waste \n\nBy: \u301079\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \n\nDate:\n\n27 Mar, 2013\n\nFrom 2 April the capital&#x27;s refuse company AMA Roma will provide a free home collection service for bulky household rubbish, such as sofas, beds, televisions sets and washing machines, which will be taken away for recycling and correct disposal.\n\nThere is no cost for the service which is only for domestic use and is aimed at tackling the problem of illegal dumping. The new home collection service will replace the 186 mobile collection points around the city, which will be phased out by 30 April.\n\nThe service permits householders to throw out up to two cubic metres of volume which is the equivalent of a three-seater couch; a table plus large-screen television; or a washing machine and dishwasher. The service can be used up to a maximum of 12 times a year and no more than twice a month.\n\nIn addition to the bulky household waste, AMA will also collect electronic appliances such as washing machines, refrigerators, freezers, dishwashers, computers, monitors, printers, televisions, music systems, fans and hair dryers.\n\nHowever the service does not include toxic or hazardous waste such as used batteries, expired medicines, neon lighting tubes, solvents or material containing asbestos. Neither does it include objects that are burnt, wet or mouldy.\n\nIn cases where the amount of rubbish to be thrown out adds up to more than two cubic metres, or is non-domestic waste, AMA Roma continues its collection system of before, for a fee.\n\nThe new service works by making an appointment by calling 060606 Mon-Fri from 09.00-18.00 and Sat 09.00-16.00, alternatively by filling out the online form on the \u301082\u2020AMA website\u2020www.amaroma.it\u3011. When booking, just insert your individual user code (found on the top right of your AMA bills).\n\nOnce an appointment is made, the objects being thrown out must be taken to the street level for collection. The AMA workers will have an identity badge and will provide you with a receipt outlining the type of material collected.\n\nSHARE\n\n\u301083\u2020 Facebook \u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 \u301084\u2020 Twitter \u2020twitter.com\u3011  \u301085\u2020 \u2020pinterest.com\u3011 \u301086\u2020 \u2020send\u3011 \n\n  * Categories / Tags\n  * \u301081\u2020Environment\u3011\n\nPrevious article \u301087\u2020The Italian mar\u00f2 and India\u3011 \n\nNext article \u301087\u2020The Italian mar\u00f2 and India\u3011 \n\n\u301079\u2020 \u3011 \n\n\u301079\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \u301079\u2020https://www.wantedinrome.com\u3011 \n\nWanted in Rome is a monthly magazine in English for expatriates in Rome established in 1985. The magazine covers Rome news stories that may be of interest to English and Italian speaking residents, and tourists as well. The publication also offers classifieds, photos, information on events, museums, churches, galleries, exhibits, fashion, food, and local travel.\n\n\u301088\u2020 \u3011 \n  2. \u301015\u2020 News \u3011 \n  3. \u301078\u2020 Return of bulky waste collection service in Rome \u3011 \n\n\u301015\u2020 News \u3011  \u301079\u2020 Environment \u3011 \n\n#  Return of bulky waste collection service in Rome \n\nBy: \u301077\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \n\nDate:\n\n01 Dec, 2016\n\nAMA Roma reinstates collection of large domestic items.\n\nThe capital&#x27;s refuse agency AMA Roma has reinstated its collection of bulky household waste, which had been suspended since 18 June due to a non-renewal of the contract.\n\nThe service, which is active from 1 December, includes the collection of items such as old sofas, beds, televisions sets and washing machines.\n\nThe service is free for those living on street level, as well as from courtyards, front doors or accessible garages, with a maximum of two cubic metres of volume. This is the equivalent of a three-seater couch; a table plus large-screen television; or a washing machine and dishwasher.\n\nFor those without street access there is a collection fee: \u20ac18.34 for up to one cubic metre of waste, or \u20ac29.34 for up to two cubic metres. The service \u2013 for street level and upper level \u2013 can be used up to a maximum of 12 times a year and no more than twice a month.\n\nTo book an appointment tel. 060606 Mon-Fri from 09.00-18.00 and Sat 09.00-16.00, alternatively compile the online form on the \u301080\u2020AMA website\u2020www.amaroma.it\u3011. When booking, insert your individual user code (found on the top right of your AMA bills).\n\nThe reactivation of the service follows the recent \u301081\u2020&quot;Frigogate&quot; \u3011comments by Rome mayor Virginia Raggi who voiced suspicions over an allegedly large amount of refrigerators abandoned on streets around the capital.\n\nSHARE\n\n\u301082\u2020 Facebook \u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 \u301083\u2020 Twitter \u2020twitter.com\u3011  \u301084\u2020 \u2020pinterest.com\u3011 \u301085\u2020 \u2020send\u3011 \n\n  * Categories / Tags\n  * \u301079\u2020Environment\u3011\n\nPrevious article \u301086\u2020World AIDS Day in Rome\u3011 \n\nNext article \u301087\u2020Fire destroys Rome&#x27;s Pineta Sacchetti auditorium\u3011 \n\n\u301077\u2020 \u3011 \n\n\u301077\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \u301077\u2020https://www.wantedinrome.com\u3011 \n\nWanted in Rome is a monthly magazine in English for expatriates in Rome established in 1985. The magazine covers Rome news stories that may be of interest to English and Italian speaking residents, and tourists as well. The publication also offers classifieds, photos, information on events, museums, churches, galleries, exhibits, fashion, food, and local travel.\n\n\u301088\u2020 for sale in town\u3011\n    * \u301027\u2020Property for sale out of town\u3011\n    * \u301028\u2020Rooms and flat shares\u3011\n\n[Image 1: Ambrit 1920 x 116]\n\n[Image 2: Ambrit 1920 x 116]\n\n[Image 3: Ambrit 1920 x 116]\n\n[Image 4: AuR Summer 24 700 x 180]\n\n  1. \u301079\u2020 Home \u3011 \n  2. \u301015\u2020 News \u3011 \n  3. \u301080\u2020 Free collection for bulky waste \u3011 \n\n\u301015\u2020 News \u3011  \u301081\u2020 Environment \u3011 \n\n#  Free collection for bulky waste \n\nBy: \u301079\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \n\nDate:\n\n27 Mar, 2013\n\nFrom 2 April the capital&#x27;s refuse company AMA Roma will provide a free home collection service for bulky household rubbish, such as sofas, beds, televisions sets and washing machines, which will be taken away for recycling and correct disposal.\n\nThere is no cost for the service which is only for domestic use and is aimed at tackling the problem of illegal dumping. The new home collection service will replace the 186 mobile collection points around the city, which will be phased out by 30 April.\n\nThe service permits householders to throw out up to two cubic metres of volume which is the equivalent of a three-seater couch; a table plus large-screen television; or a washing machine and dishwasher. The service can be used up to a maximum of 12 times a year and no more than twice a month.\n\nIn addition to the bulky household waste, AMA will also collect electronic appliances such as washing machines, refrigerators, freezers, dishwashers, computers, monitors, printers, televisions, music systems, fans and hair dryers.\n\nHowever the service does not include toxic or hazardous waste such as used batteries, expired medicines, neon lighting tubes, solvents or material containing asbestos. Neither does it include objects that are burnt, wet or mouldy.\n\nIn cases where the amount of rubbish to be thrown out adds up to more than two cubic metres, or is non-domestic waste, AMA Roma continues its collection system of before, for a fee.\n\nThe new service works by making an appointment by calling 060606 Mon-Fri from 09.00-18.00 and Sat 09.00-16.00, alternatively by filling out the online form on the \u301082\u2020AMA website\u2020www.amaroma.it\u3011. When booking, just insert your individual user code (found on the top right of your AMA bills).\n\nOnce an appointment is made, the objects being thrown out must be taken to the street level for collection. The AMA workers will have an identity badge and will provide you with a receipt outlining the type of material collected.\n\nSHARE\n\n\u301083\u2020 Facebook \u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 \u301084\u2020 Twitter \u2020twitter.com\u3011  \u301085\u2020 \u2020pinterest.com\u3011 \u301086\u2020 \u2020send\u3011 \n\n  * Categories / Tags\n  * \u301081\u2020Environment\u3011\n\nPrevious article \u301087\u2020The Italian mar\u00f2 and India\u3011 \n\nNext article \u301087\u2020The Italian mar\u00f2 and India\u3011 \n\n\u301079\u2020 \u3011 \n\n\u301079\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \u301079\u2020https://www.wantedinrome.com\u3011 \n\nWanted in Rome is a monthly magazine in English for expatriates in Rome established in 1985. The magazine covers Rome news stories that may be of interest to English and Italian speaking residents, and tourists as well. The publication also offers classifieds, photos, information on events, museums, churches, galleries, exhibits, fashion, food, and local travel.\n\n\u301088\u2020  \u301079\u2020 Environment \u3011 \n\n#  Return of bulky waste collection service in Rome \n\nBy: \u301077\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \n\nDate:\n\n01 Dec, 2016\n\nAMA Roma reinstates collection of large domestic items.\n\nThe capital&#x27;s refuse agency AMA Roma has reinstated its collection of bulky household waste, which had been suspended since 18 June due to a non-renewal of the contract.\n\nThe service, which is active from 1 December, includes the collection of items such as old sofas, beds, televisions sets and washing machines.\n\nThe service is free for those living on street level, as well as from courtyards, front doors or accessible garages, with a maximum of two cubic metres of volume. This is the equivalent of a three-seater couch; a table plus large-screen television; or a washing machine and dishwasher.\n\nFor those without street access there is a collection fee: \u20ac18.34 for up to one cubic metre of waste, or \u20ac29.34 for up to two cubic metres. The service \u2013 for street level and upper level \u2013 can be used up to a maximum of 12 times a year and no more than twice a month.\n\nTo book an appointment tel. 060606 Mon-Fri from 09.00-18.00 and Sat 09.00-16.00, alternatively compile the online form on the \u301080\u2020AMA website\u2020www.amaroma.it\u3011. When booking, insert your individual user code (found on the top right of your AMA bills).\n\nThe reactivation of the service follows the recent \u301081\u2020&quot;Frigogate&quot; \u3011comments by Rome mayor Virginia Raggi who voiced suspicions over an allegedly large amount of refrigerators abandoned on streets around the capital.\n\nSHARE\n\n\u301082\u2020 Facebook \u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 \u301083\u2020 Twitter \u2020twitter.com\u3011  \u301084\u2020 \u2020pinterest.com\u3011 \u301085\u2020 \u2020send\u3011 \n\n  * Categories / Tags\n  * \u301079\u2020Environment\u3011\n\nPrevious article \u301086\u2020World AIDS Day in Rome\u3011 \n\nNext article \u301087\u2020Fire destroys Rome&#x27;s Pineta Sacchetti auditorium\u3011 \n\n\u301077\u2020 \u3011 \n\n\u301077\u2020Wanted in Rome\u3011 \u301077\u2020https://www.wantedinrome.com\u3011 \n\nWanted in Rome is a monthly magazine in English for expatriates in Rome established in 1985. The magazine covers Rome news stories that may be of interest to English and Italian speaking residents, and tourists as well. The publication also offers classifieds, photos, information on events, museums, churches, galleries, exhibits, fashion, food, and local travel.\n\n\u301088\u2020 If you&#x27;re looking for roles that advertise a rapid hiring process, here are some options you might consider:\n\n1. **Seasonal and Temporary Positions**:\n   - **Retail Staff**: Especially during holiday seasons, retailers often hire quickly to meet increased demand.\n   - **Event Staff**: Concerts, festivals, and sporting events frequently need ushers, ticket takers, and security on short notice.\n\n2. **Customer Service Representatives**:\n   - Call centers and customer support roles often have a high turnover and may offer immediate hiring to fill vacancies.\n\n3. **Healthcare Support Roles**:\n   - **Certified Nursing Assistants (CNAs)** and **Home Health Aides** are in high demand, and some facilities offer expedited hiring processes.\n   - **Medical Technicians** in labs and diagnostic centers.\n\n4. **Hospitality Industry**:\n   - **Restaurant Staff**: Servers, bartenders, and kitchen staff are often needed urgently in busy establishments.\n   - **Hotel Staff**: Positions like housekeeping, front desk clerks, and concierge services.\n\n5. **Warehouse and Logistics**:\n   - **Warehouse Workers**: Companies like Amazon frequently have rapid hiring events.\n   - **Delivery Drivers**: With the rise of online shopping, delivery services often need drivers quickly.\n\n6. **Construction and Manual Labor**:\n   - **General Laborers**: Construction sites may hire workers immediately to meet project deadlines.\n   - **Skilled Tradespeople**: Electricians, plumbers, and carpenters are sometimes needed on short notice.\n\n7. **Gig Economy Roles**:\n   - Platforms like **Uber**, **Lyft**, **DoorDash**, and **Instacart** allow you to start working relatively quickly after background checks.\n\n8. **Administrative and Clerical Work**:\n   - Temp agencies often have short-term assignments that need immediate staffing.\n\n9. **Education Sector**:\n   - **Substitute Teachers**: Schools often need substitutes on short notice.\n   - **Tutors**: Especially during exam seasons.\n\n10. **Security Personnel**:\n    - Events, retail stores, and corporate offices may require security staff urgently.\n\n**Tips to Find Rapid Hire Positions**:\n\n- **Job Search Platforms**: Use filters like &quot;immediate hire,&quot; &quot;urgent,&quot; or &quot;start immediately&quot; on sites like Indeed, LinkedIn, and Glassdoor.\n- **Staffing Agencies**: Register with agencies that specialize in quick placements.\n- **Company Websites**: Some companies advertise rapid hiring events or walk-in interviews on their career pages.\n- **Local Classifieds**: Check local newspapers or community boards.\n- **Networking**: Let friends and family know you&#x27;re available for immediate work\u2014they might know of openings.\n\n**Preparation**:\n\n- **Resume**: Keep an updated resume ready to send at a moment&#x27;s notice.\n- **Certificates**: Have digital copies of any certifications or licenses you hold.\n- **Background Checks**: Some roles require background checks or drug testing; be prepared for this process.\n- **Flexible Availability**: Being open to various shifts can increase your chances of quick employment.\n\nIf you need assistance tailoring your search to a specific industry or location, or if you&#x27;d like help with your resume or interview preparation, feel free to ask!"]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true
